author: @fox5vegas
title: UNLV Football recruit had chest pains before he died, report says
text:
UNLV Football recruit had chest pains before he died, report says
LAS VEGAS, Nev. (FOX5) - A report from Las Vegas police revealed that a UNLV Football recruit had chest pains before he died.
FOX5 obtained the incident report when Metro police responded to a home near Tropicana and Maryland on Feb. 11.
When officers arrived, they found Benjamin Christman dead. He was 21. Police were met by two men who said they went to check up on him since he didn‚Äôt show up to practice.
When the pair arrived, they told police he was motionless.
Another person at the scene told officers that Christman had chest pains during practice. They said a coach conducted an EKG on him at UNLV and sent him to their team‚Äôs cardio doctor.
Everything looked normal, they told police.
Police interviewed another person who said Christman went into his room the night before, saying hello. They wouldn‚Äôt see him again for the rest of the night and next day.
Police said they did not find any weapons, narcotics, medications or suspicious items in the house.
His hometown was Akron, Ohio.
A UNLV spokesperson provided the following statement:

author: Rodrigo Moinhos
title: Pr√™mio Educa√ß√£o Fiscal: 1¬∫ e 2¬∫ lugares ficam com Minas
text:
Dois projetos desenvolvidos em Minas Gerais e apoiados pelo governo do Estado subiram ao p√≥dio na noite da √∫ltima quarta-feira (4), para receber o Pr√™mio Nacional de Educa√ß√£o Fiscal. O evento, realizado em Bras√≠lia, reconheceu os projetos da professora Raquel Moura, da Escola Municipal Filomena de Oliveira Leite, de Curvelo, que ficou em primeiro lugar na categoria Escolas, e da professora Eliana Demarques, da Escola Estadual Helena Guerra, de Contagem, que levou a segunda coloca√ß√£o na categoria Tecnologia.
De acordo com Luiz Antonio Zanon, servidor da Secretaria de Estado de Fazenda (SEF) e coordenador do Programa de Educa√ß√£o Fiscal Estadual (Proefe), os trof√©us corroboram o bom trabalho feito pelas equipes de Educa√ß√£o Fiscal espalhadas pelo Estado, tanto pelas superintend√™ncias regionais da Fazenda quanto da Educa√ß√£o.
‚ÄúO Programa de Educa√ß√£o Fiscal em Minas j√° tem mais de 30 anos. √â um trabalho s√©rio e dedicado que busca difundir entre os mineiros a participa√ß√£o cidad√£ no controle social dos tributos e acompanhamento da aplica√ß√£o dos recursos p√∫blicos‚Äù, afirmou.
Conhe√ßa os projetos vencedores do Pr√™mio Nacional de Educa√ß√£o Fiscal: Projeto Educa√ß√£o Fiscal e Cidadania: Juntas na constru√ß√£o de uma consci√™ncia cidad√£ transformadora ‚Äì inclui atividades como palestras, leitura cr√≠tica sobre tributos, jogos educativos e a√ß√µes de sustentabilidade. Alunos e familiares aprendem sobre o papel dos tributos, a diferen√ßa entre bens p√∫blicos e privados e a import√¢ncia de reduzir o desperd√≠cio, promovendo uma cultura cidad√£ e sustent√°vel. Projeto Biblioteca Interativa da Educa√ß√£o Inclusiva (BIEI) ‚Äì pretende inovar o modelo de servi√ßo presente nas bibliotecas p√∫blicas municipais e escolares, com foco na oferta de ‚Äúmaterial did√°tico atualizado, integrando temas contempor√¢neos e transversais, com o objetivo de contribuir para a forma√ß√£o integral do estudante, especialmente no que se refere ao letramento financeiro‚Äù. Minas Gerais tem tradi√ß√£o no pr√™mio, criado em 2012 e organizado pela Associa√ß√£o Nacional das Associa√ß√µes de Fiscais de Tributos Estaduais (Febrafite).
Por meio do Proefe, coordenado pela SEF e com parceria da Secretaria de Estado de Educa√ß√£o (SEE), ao longo dos 12 anos do pr√™mio, dez projetos mineiros receberam o trof√©u.
Confira os vencedores de Minas no pr√™mio educa√ß√£o fiscal nos √∫ltimos 12 anos ( Com informa√ß√µes da Ag√™ncia Minas )

author: La r√©daction
title: Vis√© par une enqu√™te pour apologie du terrorisme et des pr√™ches radicaux, l'imam du Gard Mahjoub Mahjoubi a √©t√© expuls√© vers la Tunisie - Nice-Matin
text:
L'imam Mahjoub Mahjoubi, vis√© par une enqu√™te pour apologie du terrorisme et des pr√™ches radicaux, √©t√© expuls√© jeudi soir vers la Tunisie "moins de 12 heures apr√®s son interpellation" √† Bagnols (Gard), a annonc√© G√©rald Darmanin.
Dans un message post√© sur X (anciennement Twitter), le ministre de l'Int√©rieur a fait valoir que la d√©cision visant l'imam de nationalit√© tunisienne √©tait "la d√©monstration que la loi immigration, sans laquelle une telle expulsion aussi rapide n'aurait pas √©t√© possible, rend la France plus forte".
¬´ L‚ÄôImam ¬ª radical Mahjoub Mahjoubi vient d‚Äô√™tre expuls√© du territoire national, moins de 12h apr√®s son interpellation.
C‚Äôest la d√©monstration que la loi Immigration, sans laquelle une telle expulsion aussi rapide n‚Äôaurait pas √©t√© possible, rend la France plus forte. Nous ne‚Ä¶
‚Äî G√©rald DARMANIN (@GDarmanin) February 22, 2024 Accus√© d'avoir prof√©r√© des appels √† la haine visant les femmes, les Juifs ou une soci√©t√© fran√ßaise "pourrie" dans des pr√™ches, l'imam tunisien de la mosqu√©e de Bagnols-sur-C√®ze (Gard), Mahjoub Mahjoubi, avait √©t√© interpell√© plus t√¥t dans la journ√©e, ce jeudi en vue de son expulsion, qu'il entend contester.
Install√© en France depuis le milieu des ann√©es 1980, p√®re de quatre enfants, Mahjoub Mahjoubi a "fait l'objet d'une visite domiciliaire et d'une interpellation" , a annonc√© jeudi sur X (anciennement Twitter) le ministre de l'Int√©rieur, G√©rald Darmanin, qui avait r√©clam√© dimanche le retrait de son titre de s√©jour.
Interpell√© √† la mi-journ√©e sur la base d'un arr√™t√© minist√©riel d'expulsion en pr√©sence de ses enfants et de son √©pouse, selon son avocat, Samir Hamroun, il a √©t√© emmen√© pour √™tre transf√©r√© vers un centre de r√©tention administrative (CRA) en r√©gion parisienne.
"Sans la loi immigration, cela n'aurait pas pu √™tre possible. La fermet√© est la r√®gle" , a affirm√© M. Darmanin, en fustigeant un " 'imam' radical aux propos inacceptables".
Les pr√™ches analys√©s "rec√®lent bien d'autres choses que ce pseudo lapsus" Mahjoub Mahjoubi s'√©tait fait conna√Ætre il y a quelques jours essentiellement pour une vid√©o circulant sur les r√©seaux sociaux dans laquelle il qualifiait le "drapeau tricolore" - sans pr√©ciser s'il s'agissait du drapeau fran√ßais - de "drapeau satanique " qui n'aurait "aucune valeur aupr√®s d'Allah".
Il s'√©tait d√©fendu lundi en √©voquant un "lapsus" , expliquant qu'il d√©non√ßait en r√©alit√© les rivalit√©s entre supporters des pays du Maghreb lors de la r√©cente Coupe d'Afrique des Nations de football.
Toutefois, les pr√™ches analys√©s "rec√®lent bien d'autres choses que ce pseudo lapsus" , avait r√©pliqu√© mardi le pr√©fet du Gard, J√©r√¥me Bonet, sur franceinfo.
De fait, si l'on en croit l'arr√™t√© d'expulsion, les propos reproch√©s √† l'imam tunisien couvrent un champ bien plus large que ce d√©bat autour du drapeau. Dans des pr√™ches des 2, 9 et 16 f√©vrier " portant sur les signes annonciateurs de la Fin des Temps", Mahjoub Mahjoubi " a v√©hicul√© une conception litt√©rale, r√©trograde, intol√©rante et violente de l'islam, de nature √† encourager des comportements contraires aux valeurs de la R√©publique, la discrimination √† l'√©gard des femmes, le repli identitaire, les tensions avec la communaut√© juive et la radicalisation jihadiste" , rel√®ve l'arr√™t√©, consult√© par l'AFP.
Les autorit√©s fran√ßaises accusent aussi l'imam de "propos haineux et discriminatoires √† l'√©gard des non-musulmans et de la soci√©t√© fran√ßaise", qu'il aurait d√©crite comme "belliqueuse et pourrie".
Il appelait "√† la destruction de la soci√©t√© occidentale jug√©e d√©cadente" Toujours selon l'arr√™t√© minist√©riel, l'imam d√©signait devant ses fid√®les "le peuple juif comme un ennemi". Il appelait "√† la destruction de la soci√©t√© occidentale jug√©e d√©cadente" et faisait "l'√©loge de la charia, seule loi l√©gitime et juste √† ses yeux", selon la m√™me source. Le 2 f√©vrier, il d√©plorait que "les mosqu√©es ne produisent plus de combattants comme au temps du proph√®te".
En plus d'enclencher la proc√©dure d'expulsion, M. Darmanin avait demand√© au pr√©fet de signaler ces propos √† la justice. Une d√©marche √† l'issue de laquelle la procureure de N√Æmes, C√©cile Gensac, avait annonc√© lundi avoir ouvert une enqu√™te pr√©liminaire pour "apologie du terrorisme".
L'avocat de Mahjoub Mahjoubi, Samir Hamroun, a confirm√© jeudi √† l'AFP qu'il allait contester son expulsion: " Pour la requ√™te en r√©f√©r√©, c'est le juge des libert√©s et de la d√©tention du tribunal de Meaux qui est comp√©tent".
"Pour le fond - +Il a dit ci, il a pas dit √ßa...+ -, √ßa sera devant le tribunal administratif de Paris" , a ajout√© l'avocat, selon qui son client est "abasourdi" et "boulevers√©".
Avant son interpellation, l'imam de Bagnols-sur-C√®ze avait affirm√© soutenir les valeurs de la R√©publique et la la√Øcit√©: "Bien entendu, j'ai d√©fendu Samuel Paty (le professeur assassin√© en 2020 par un jeune jihadiste). J'√©tais dans la marche pour Charlie Hebdo", avait-il affirm√©.

author: Ahmedabad Mirror
title: Let‚Äôs make Amdavad India‚Äôs cleanest city
text: Friday, October 04 2024, 08:51 AM Friday, October 04 2024, 08:51 AM Ahmedabad may not make it to the top of the list of India‚Äôs cleanest cities this year but, with proper work, the target can be achieved in next year‚Äôs Swachh Survekshan, said Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday. In Gujarat for two days, Shah was speaking at an event organised by the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation in Bhadaj area. He inaugurated and laid the foundation stones of projects costing Rs 447 crore. Ahmedabad city is part of the Gandhinagar Lok Sabha constituency which is represented by Shah. In Swachh Survekshan 2023, Indore in Madhya Pradesh and Surat in Gujarat were jointly declared the cleanest cities in the country. ‚ÄúThe AMC is aiming to bring the city on top in Swachh Survekshan. We may not achieve that target this year. But, if we start today, we can achieve the target of being the cleanest city in the country in next year‚Äôs survey,‚Äù Shah said, adding he would be meeting civic officials to chalk out a plan in this connection. ‚ÄúI urge all the citizens to take a resolve on cleanliness and cooperate with the AMC in its endeavour to make Ahmedabad the cleanest city in the country,‚Äù he said. Shah informed the audience that developmental works costing Rs 37,000 crore were undertaken in his Lok Sabha constituency during the last five years, comprising works costing Rs 23,951 crore approved by the Gujarat government and projects costing Rs 14,000 crore approved by the Centre. ‚ÄúThis is a huge achievement and I am proud to be your representative in the Lok Sabha. These projects include roads, overbridges, hospitals, libraries, gardens, schools and lake beautification,‚Äù he said.

author: Brian Warner
title: Harrison Butker Net Worth
text:
- Category:
Richest Athletes‚Ä∫ NFL Players
- Net Worth:
- $9 Million
- Salary:
- $4 Million
üí∞ Compare Harrison Butker's Net Worth
What is Harrison Butker's Net Worth and Salary?
Harrison Butker is an American professional football player who has a net worth of $9 million. Harrison Butker is probably best known for playing for the NFL's Kansas City Chiefs. With the team, he won Super Bowls LIV, LVII, and LVIII, and led the NFL in scoring in 2019. Among his other achievements, Butker is second in NFL history in career field goal percentage.
Contracts, Salary & Career Earnings
Through his first eight seasons in the NFL, Harrison earned a little more than $22.2 million in salary. The vast majority of his earnings so far have come from a 5-year, $20.275 million contract signed with the Chiefs in 2019. That contract boosted his annual salary from $555,000 to $4.1 million.
Early Life and High School
Harrison Butker was born on July 14, 1995 in Decatur, Georgia to Elizabeth and Harrison Sr. He has an older sister. As a youth, Butker attended the Westminster Schools in Atlanta, where he excelled in football, basketball, and soccer. With the soccer team, he won three state championships. Butker also played the tuba in the school's symphonic band.
Collegiate Career
For college, Butker attended Georgia Tech from 2013 to 2016, briefly playing soccer before switching to football as his chosen sport. With the Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets football team, he became the all-time leading scorer in school history, converting 208-of-210 extra point attempts and 43-of-60 field goal attempts. Butker graduated with a bachelor's degree in industrial engineering.
Carolina Panthers
In the 2017 NFL draft, Butker was chosen in the seventh round by the Carolina Panthers. He subsequently signed a four-year contract with the team. However, Butker was waived by the Panthers in September of that year, and was signed to the practice squad.
Kansas City Chiefs
From the Panthers' practice squad, Butker was signed by the Kansas City Chiefs in late September 2017. He made his debut in the team's Week 4 victory over the Washington Redskins, during which he made the game-winning field goal attempt. A few weeks later, after converting five field goals in a victory over the Denver Broncos, Butker was named AFC Special Teams Player of the Week. He went on to earn AFC Special Teams Player of the Month honors for October. Butker finished his rookie season having converted 28 extra point attempts and 38-of-42 field goal attempts as the Chiefs reached the Wild Card Round of the playoffs. In the 2018 season, he converted 65 of 69 extra point attempts and 24-of-27 field goal attempts as the Chiefs finished first in the AFC West. The team made it to the AFC Championship Game, but fell to the New England Patriots. Butker had his breakout season in 2019, leading the NFL in regular-season field goals with 34 and in points with 147. In the playoffs, the Chiefs won the Divisional Round and the AFC Championship. The team went on to defeat the San Francisco 49ers in Super Bowl LIV, giving Butker his first Super Bowl title.
Butker had another strong season in 2020, with a highlight being his franchise record-tying 58-yard field goal attempt in the Chiefs' Week 2 overtime win against the Los Angeles Chargers. The Chiefs made it back to the Super Bowl, where Butker scored all of the team's nine points in the 31-9 loss to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. The next season, the Chiefs made it through the Wild Card Round and the Divisional Round before losing to the Cincinnati Bengals in the AFC Championship Game. In the 2022 season, Butker broke his own record for longest field goal with a 62-yard field goal in a game against the Buffalo Bills. However, his season was overall poor due to a persistent ankle injury and consequent time missed. Butker was able to turn things around in the playoffs, making a 45-yard game-winning field goal to defeat the Cincinnati Bengals in the AFC Championship Game. In Super Bowl LVII, he kicked a 27-yard game-winning field goal with 11 seconds left on the clock to give the Chiefs a 38-35 win over the Philadelphia Eagles. Butker and the Chiefs won a second-consecutive Super Bowl in 2024, defeating the San Francisco 49ers 25-22 in overtime. In the game, Butker broke two Super Bowl records, for the longest made field goal (57) and the most career field goals in the Super Bowl (9).
Benedictine College Commencement Controversy
In 2024, Butler made comments that some perceived as antisemitic, sexist, and anti-LGBTQ, during a commencement address at Benedictine College that drew severe backlash. In the speech, he perpetuated the antisemitic trope that Jews were responsible for the death of Jesus, and denounced a provision of a bill drafted to condemn antisemitism. Additionally, Butler made sexist remarks about women not desiring careers but instead being "most excited about (their) marriage and the children (they) will bring into this world." He stated, "I'm on the stage today and able to be the man I am because I have a wife who leans into her vocation‚Ä¶ and embrace one of the most important titles of all: homemaker." Further, Butker denigrated the LGBTQ community when he referred to Pride Month as an example of the deadly sins.
Personal Life
Butker is a devout Catholic, and is married with two children. He is also the co-founder, president, and COO of the holding company MDKeller.

author: Cheryl Sekkappan
title: Mandai Wildlife Group Launches Good Threads, A Chic And Eco-Friendly Fashion Collection
text:
How about shorts with a detachable reusable tote bag or a bucket hat that doubles as a bag? These are some of the apparel you can find in Mandai Wildlife Group's new capsule collection, Good Threads. Consisting of 200 multi-functional pieces, the fashion collection was designed to help wearers make eco-friendly decisions in everyday life.
Photograph: Mandai Wildlife Group Good Threads was developed over six months in collaboration with Hakim Samat, a locally-based crafter known for his custom-made, upcycled creations. Sporting a rugged, patchwork look, the shirts, pants, hats, and bags in Good Threads are made from 1,158 pieces of pre-loved clothing and salvaged materials from local thrift stores like honsieponsie, Function Five Thrift Shop, and Woofie's Warehouse, as well as a grassroots textile collection drive . Buttons, carabiner hooks, and other hardware were sourced from Plastify, a homegrown startup that turns plastic trash into treasure .
Photograph: Mandai Wildlife Group The Good Threads capsule collection will be released in three phases. The first release is now available for purchase, consisting of the Takeaway Shirt, which has multiple pockets and compartments where you can keep your reusable utensils and bottles handy; the Tote Shorts, with a detachable reusable bag for spontaneous grocery shopping sprees; the Trashy Pants, with has a dual pocket organiser to help you separate plastic trash as well as a removable trash pouch; and the Bucket-Bag Hat, a convertible bucket hat that you can also use as a cute bag.
Photograph: Mandai Wildlife Group Subsequent releases are planned on March 8 and 28. Many items from the first collection are already sold out, so get shopping now at goodthreadsbymandai.sg/ . What's more, all proceeds from the sale of Good Threads will go towards supporting wildlife conservation efforts in Singapore and Southeast Asia.

Cheryl Sekkappan Deputy Editor, Time Out Singapore
